meanings.definition: A performer who uses gestures and movements to convey a story or message without speaking.
meanings.sent1: The talented mime entertained the children at the park with his silent storytelling.
meanings.sent2: The mime gracefully acted out a scene from a famous play on the street corner.
meanings.sent3: The mime's exaggerated gestures made the audience burst into laughter during the performance.
meanings.sent4: Her movements were like a mime, painting a vivid picture of a bustling city without uttering a word.
meanings.sent5: The mime's expressive face and body language brought the character to life in a magical way.

meanings.definition: To imitate or mimic someone or something through gestures and movements.
meanings.sent1: She tried to mime the actions of the dance instructor to learn the routine.
meanings.sent2: The children enjoyed miming the movements of animals during the drama class.
meanings.sent3: He decided to mime his friend's funny walk to make everyone laugh at the party.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to mime the trees' swaying as it rustled through the leaves.
meanings.sent5: The actor had to mime opening a door on stage since there was no prop available.
